str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary, but obsolete omo, for which another prolonged form omoo is used in certain tenses; to swear, i.e. Take oath.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An oath. From herkos; a limit, i.e. restraint.
Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The loins. Of uncertain affinity; the loin, i.e. The hip; internally procreative power.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
